topics.body:
*Looks at watch that I now suddenly have*

I think It's about time for another fight to break out

*Walks over to the mirror that's now in the room for some reason*

*Holds The Ryuki card deck to the mirror*

*The Ryuki Vent buckle appears in the mirror and Fastens itself onto my reflection, Making it actually appear on me at the same time*

Henshin!

!http://yosuaonesimus.files.wordpress.com/2010/07/kamen-rider-ryuki-1.jpg!

*Enters the mirror world*

topics.author: 50d9a3aea4c72dc9b3000120

topics.body:
Hey guys I gotta ask, but what do you think that this would work with MLP? 
A semi-text based game with pictures/comics which we vote on how to act or respond to different scenarios. The story progresses on the actions we vote for and it expands, though I'm not sure if it would work well for being a single character, it could be used for large groups and communities we make. 
Essentially a world building story which everyone votes on actions of our own OCs and elected leader. 

Or is this too complicated?
topics.author: 5046d66d7f123b38980018c6

topics.body:
Here's a interesting fact: in 2011 the total computational ability and total data of all the computers in the world was equivalent to one human brain.

There's a reason why IBM and such are now looking at neurochip technology.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c5171c63687269516e0100#post_53c5171c63687269516e0100

Sort of like that, I'm not sure about how well it'd be received though.
topics.author: 5046d66d7f123b38980018c6

topics.body:
Speaking of neurochips that is probably going to be the next big thing technologically.  Right now we can only simulate a million neurons through neurochips, but in say five to ten years even on the most basic things we're talking a massive performance increase for even your home computer or such.  Realistically speaking obviously you're not going to have neurochip cpu's in the next year or so cause it's still being worked on; rather in five to ten years though.

. . Wait; I mean neurochip as in a circuit board that mimics brain cells not a neurochip that attaches to brain cells.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
